intro: Epilobium subalgidum, commonly known as the alpine willow or narrow-leaved willow, is a herbaceous plant native to alpine and arctic regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Epilobium subalgidum is adapted to cold climates and grows in rocky or sandy soils at high elevations. It is often found in tundra and mountainous areas where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
